meanings.definition: Excessive concern with propriety or modesty, especially in a sexual context.
meanings.sent1: Her prudery made her uncomfortable with any mention of intimacy.
meanings.sent2: The prudery of the Victorian era restricted open discussions about certain topics.
meanings.sent3: Despite her prudery, she couldn't help but blush at the playful innuendo.
meanings.sent4: The prudery of the old society was like a heavy cloak, suffocating any hint of freedom.
meanings.sent5: His prudery was so extreme that even a hint of impropriety would send him into a panic.

meanings.definition: Behavior or attitudes that are excessively proper or modest.
meanings.sent1: Her prudery extended to always wearing long skirts and high-necked blouses.
meanings.sent2: The prudery of the town council led to strict rules on public behavior.
meanings.sent3: His prudery was so extreme that he refused to even say certain words out loud.
meanings.sent4: The prudery of the group was like a shield against any form of fun or spontaneity.
meanings.sent5: Their prudery was so ingrained that even a hint of informality made them uncomfortable.
